page.title: 09Bondleigh Farm Mechanisation
page.content: Nearly every farm now has{two}or more {tractors,}diesel fuel having taken the place of petrol and vapourising oil. Whilst ownership and use of the{binder for cutting of standing corn, which then requires stacking into stooks to facilitate drying has declined, many farmers now own a{combine}harvester. {Drying}of combined grain, achieved by use of hot air blowers, forcing air through from the bottom of stack or silo. {Seed sowing}by hydraulic controlled drill.{Precision drilled}crops are mangold, turnips, potatoes, swedes, some grown for human consumption requiring uniformity for presentation. {Grass}seeds are spread by fertilizer spinner. Most recent innovation in this rural area is{airial spraying}of growing crops for control of air borne diseases and soil pest eradication.
